EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.96}.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum heat value in the heatmap?
EVJ.A: The global minimum heat value is {0.18}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Ratings on the y-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value for Ratings on the y-axis is {0.93}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Events on the x-axis?
EVJ.A: The maximum heat value of Events on the x-axis is {0.96}.

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Media Rights on the x-axis?
SC.A: The average heat value for Media Rights on the x-axis is {0.73}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Events and Fan Engagement or the cell corresponding to Gaming and Revenue?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Events} and {Fan Engagement} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Media Rights and Fan Engagement or the cell corresponding to Movies and Ratings?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Movies} and {Ratings} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Events and Merchandise or the cell corresponding to Tennis and Merchandise?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Events} and {Merchandise} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Gaming and Attendance or the cell corresponding to Publishing and Ratings?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Gaming} and {Attendance} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.24 to 0.37?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Tennis, Attendance), (Theater, Fan Engagement), (Events, Streaming Hours), (Football, Viewership)}.
